      • getAvailableModes

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getAvailableModes()

      • getMode

        public SensorMode getMode(int mode)
        Get a SensorMode associated with a mode index.

        WARNING: This function does not switch the sensor to the correct mode. Unless the sensor is switched to the correct mode, the reads from this SensorMode will be invalid. See GenericMode.fetchSample(float[], int)

      • getMode

        public SensorMode getMode(java.lang.String modeName)
        Get a SensorMode associated with a mode name.

        WARNING: This function does not switch the sensor to the correct mode. Unless the sensor is switched to the correct mode, the reads from this SensorMode will be invalid. See GenericMode.fetchSample(float[], int)

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()

      • sampleSize

        public int sampleSize()

      • fetchSample

        public void fetchSample(float[] sample,
                        int offset)
        Set the current SensorMode index.

        WARNING: this function works properly only when the sensor is already in the appropriate mode. This means that the returned reading will be valid only when you previously activated the "current mode" via a call to get*Mode() or switchMode(). See GenericMode.fetchSample(float[], int)

        Parameters:
        sample - The array to store the sample in.
        offset - The elements of the sample are stored in the array starting at the offset position.

      • setCurrentMode

        public void setCurrentMode(int mode)
        Set the current SensorMode index.

        WARNING: This function does not switch the sensor to the correct mode. Unless the sensor is switched to the correct mode, the reads from the"current" SensorMode will be invalid. See GenericMode.fetchSample(float[], int)

      • getCurrentMode

        public int getCurrentMode()

      • setCurrentMode

        public void setCurrentMode(java.lang.String modeName)
        Set the current SensorMode name.

        WARNING: This function does not switch the sensor to the correct mode. Unless the sensor is switched to the correct mode, the reads from the"current" SensorMode will be invalid. See GenericMode.fetchSample(float[], int)

      • getModeCount

        public int getModeCount()

      • getSystemMode

        protected java.lang.String getSystemMode()
        Read current sensor mode from the kernel.
        Returns:
        Sensor mode identifier.

      • setSystemMode

        private void setSystemMode(java.lang.String mode)
        Write requested sensor mode to the kernel.
        Parameters:
        mode - Sensor mode identifier.

      • switchMode

        public void switchMode(java.lang.String newMode,
                       long switchDelay)
        Switch the sensor to the specified mode, if necessary.

        Note: the mode switch will make future reads from SensorModes for other modes invalid. On the other hand, it will make reads valid for the SensorMode associated with the mode the sensor is switching to. See GenericMode.fetchSample(float[], int)

        Parameters:
        newMode - Identifier of the sensor mode (not its name).
        switchDelay - Delay until the sensor starts sending new data.
